title: I really messed up, what do you think will happen? (Would really appreciate a RED(Riot member) reply
body:
Alright so, it's late 1:50 AM and I think to myself: I have RP to spend whats something nice i can buy? so I'm scrolling through and ultimately decide on Eternum Nocturne, I goto nocturnes page and when i goto the skin it just doesn't pop up with the option to buy, then when i went to the store i couldn't buy it from there too, so a  little annoyed I logged off and logged back in, i then proceeded to open the shop and just as I'm about to start  searching for eternum nocturne I get a message on skype, I minimize league and reply to my friend, now somehow I've really messed up here, i bring league back up and in the corner of my eye I just see the word "eternum" now since this skin is new it's at the top of the shop, it also has the same color  theme as its the same skin theme and my mind must of been absent at the time because I managed to buy ETERNUM REKSAI that's right, I screwed up hard on this one and I'm really annoyed  and I'm hoping to try and find a solution. so i did some searching and I eventually found this page https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864-Content-Refund-FAQ  it says that if you accidentally buy  a skin you don't get a refund: 

"I ACCIDENTALLY PURCHASED SOMETHING! CAN I HAVE A FREE REFUND?
We will not provide free refunds for accidental purchases under any circumstances. The only way for you to refund an accidentally purchased item is by using your refund token. When making a purchase, please double check to make sure you are buying your desired item. The store will prompt you to confirm before completing the purchase."

I saw this and I thought, well great, at this time I've already submitted a ticket but it wasn't exactly my fault (Yes it was my fault but let me explain)
the first time I would of easily bought eternum nocturne and been happy however, Riot's shop glitched out on me, if this hadn't of happened then I never would of had to re-log.

I haven't used to Rek'Sai skin, and I don't plan on using it either, it was an honest mistake and half Riot's fault too, I know what it says but I'm really hoping I can get some leniency here, do you think I will?  If not then it will be a complete waste of RP and  not to make threats but if I won't be able to get a refund or atleast swap the eternum Rek'Sai and use up what would of been the rest of the cost from the rp on my account then I won't be purchasing RP again, just because I wouldn't want to purchase something from a company that I deem to be unreliable.


(PS: It was fully my fault on the second part, the only reason I believe I should be able to  refund the reksai skin and then buy eternum nocturne is because of Riot's shop messing up on me and for the sole fact that I won't be using it and haven't used it so it'd just be a waste of RP, and it's something so simple, if this issue is resolved then It'll just give me more faith in riot but if something this simple can't be resolved they've definitely lost a usual customer).

(I have 0 refund credits left).

replies.body:
As far as I know, NZ consumer guarantee laws only protects faulty items. So if it is faulty, regardless of the store's policy they ought and must give a full refund. 

Now, as far as a change of mind, it is not protected AT ALL. Which means, some stores generally do it for a gesture of goodwill so that they wont lose out on that customer. Now this means that their policy matter. 

From what I read of the refund policy, Riot gives you 3 refund tokens as a gesture of goodwill. You are not meant to abuse these, as these are meant for those 'accidental purchases' that you might do. They give you 3 errors. That to me, is not ripping people off, because as I said, a change of mind is not protected under any consumers laws in NZ. 

You can take my two cents or leave it. I'm a law student, so I'm not qualified to give advice lol.
Is OP trying to imply Riot cares about their customers lmao as if.

You can kill some1, u can easily get away in NA if you got the money by legal means. So much corruption in NA and even in Aus to some point.

In NZ people actually care about each other and their community lol. 

If they ripped me off, I would be so pissed lol. I would go to internet cafe, contact my mates, get around 1000 reports from their previous purchases, and sue them.

Luckily I have not yet been ripped of by Riot. 

Say if you are unfairly treated by Riot, they should have treated 1000 others the same way. It is not 10 dollars now, may be 100000's of dollars when ripping of 1000's of people.
You realize The T&C you agree to mean you can take them to court and only waste your own money yeah?

If the agreement is created in a way to rip off the users, then it can be taken to the courts and you win. Lots of companies bigger than Riot got sued that way. 

A T&C that is fair to one country like NA does not mean it is fair to every other country where that particular government value consumers more than businesses.

My point is if Riot is ripping of 1000's of people intentionally, an agreement can make them pay less fine. The punishment might be reduced, and they may pay less fine, still they name is ruined to NZ gamers as a untrustworthy company where every1 should be careful.

As I said, they have not ripped me off, so i don;'t really care lol ;D

Hint: your ripping yourself off, the T&C aren't designed to rip off users.

For example, it is all OP's fault he bought the wrong skin, not riots, they are not obliged to give a refund.

If he bought a wrong skin while his screen is glitched then yeah. I got a champion refunded since I bought the wrong one in a glitched screen. I sent them a screen shot and some game logs as a proof and then they refunded. So as I said Riot has not ripped me off yet.

His case might be different though as you have pointed out it is the OP's fault. He still might get some compensation from Riot, if Riot felt sorry for him. He need screen shots and log files etc when the issue occurred.

Yeah thing is Riot don't rip people off, this guy %%%%ed up, and honestly it's a matter of suck it up, there are a lot of places that won't give you a refund simply cause you bought the wrong thing of a similar type (i assume it would be the same there) eg. if you bought AAA battery's instead of AA battery's, that's your fault for not reading them.
My bad.
There should be a 5 minute window to do a refund at-least.We all make mistakes.
People should check they're about to purchase the right thing. It only takes a second.
Also, there's this thing in law called caveat emptor, in most cases, that would be what the district court judge say to you and bid you to leave.

Considering that you are told what you are purchasing multiple times, and that there is a pop-up to **confirm** what you are purchasing, it's not Riots fault for an accidental purchase. It is your responsibility to make sure you are purchasing the item you want.
It bothers me that they have this all purchases are final mentality, since so many stores are legally obligated in some places to give refunds.

All big stores in NZ are legally obligated to give refund.

Only the ones planning to Rip you Off wont give a refund. You can submit a report to consumer.org.nz if you live in New Zealand and they contact Riot. If Riot don't give you a refund, then they will be blacklisted for consumers to be aware of. Especially this can be dangerous times for Riot since they are lag issues caused by their upgraded servers.

If Riot is blacklisted in NZ, Aus may follow, but since Aus is capitalist they may not.

But NZ is consumers oriented. Riot implementing Rip off policies like they do in Capitalist NA and Australia lol.

The sad news is NZ is slowly turning into a capitalist country due to greedy John Key who is a elite banker and capitalist Arse kisser.

Riot is still not aware of this issue.

All it needs is 100 reports from 100 different people. If more than 1000 people submit reports, the case is taken to courts.

You've already bought the RP, which is what Riot gets the money from, so its not like they are losing out by letting you have your swap.

Exactly... how it would probably be viewed is that If I want eternum Nocturne then I have to buy more RP to get it.. but I'd never buy RP again so they'd end up losing more than they would gain by not letting me do a simple swap... sigh... if only I liked to play rek'sai then maybe it wouldn't be so bad but this skin will be completely useless to me, really hope something can be done, probably wont even use it unless I maybe get aram rek'sai but even then I don't play ARAM that much, sorry if I seem to be complaining but if this can't be resolved that's $10 wasted.

I know that may be the case but it was an honest mistake that really wouldn't of occurred if their client didn't bug out in the first place :/ and even if it didn't bug out would it really be such a harmful thing for them to let me exchange a skin? but I guess if they do it to save money it will backfire because I would of spent more money but if something this small is not allowed then they've lost money... lol not going to buy more rp on the chance that if something similar happens and they're just not lenient, but I'm hoping Riot will be lenient in this case... they seem to have good customer support and I don't think they'd wanna lose someone who is a regular like me but I've seen cases like this before... all I can do is hope I guess.
